entry.title: Weekly NFT Sales Dip by 1.18% Despite Rising Buyers and Transactions
entry.summary:
Based on the most recent week-long data, non-fungible token (NFT) sales experienced a slight decline of 1.18% from the previous week. Despite a recorded $107.05 million in NFT sales, there was a noteworthy rise of 86.71% in the number of buyers. Additionally, NFT transactions increased by a significant 34.66%.
Weekly Digital Collectible Sales Cool Off
This week, NFT sales showed a minor dip, declining by 1.18% compared to the previous week. Out of the $107.05 million in NFT transactions, a significant 61% or $65.86 million originated from the Ethereum blockchain.
Furthermore, sales of ETH-based NFTs climbed by 7.41% from the prior week. Solana trailed behind Ethereum, boasting sales of around $9.64 million, marking a 4.8% uptick.
After Solana in the NFT sales race came Polygon, â€¦

DeFi Protocol Exactly Loses $12 Million In Optimism Layer 2 Hack â€“ Details
entry.summary:
In a concerning trend for the decentralized finance, or DeFi space, two prominent protocols â€“ Exactly and Harbor â€“ have fallen victim to separate attacks. These incidents, the latest in a string of recent exploits, have highlighted the vulnerabilities that can arise within the relatively new and experimental world of DeFi.
Exactly, a credit market operating on the Optimism network, clearly did not see it coming. The attack, first uncovered by blockchain security firm DeDotFi, involved hackers exploiting a weakness in Exactlyâ€™s smart contracts. Security firm PeckShield said on X (formerly Twitter) that it had â€œdetected an ongoing attack.â€
Update: After a thorough review of the Exactly Protocol Hack, we have concluded that the total of stolen amount up to date is ~$7.2M (4323.6 $ETH) â€¦

entry.title: Banks Allowed to Issue Crypto Mastercard Cards in Uzbekistan
entry.summary:
Authorities in Uzbekistan have authorized two local banks to issue payment cards allowing users to spend their digital coins. The move is part of a pilot project to launch virtual cards linked to cryptocurrency wallets on an exchange that will facilitate instant conversion to fiat money.
Uzbekistan Banks to Launch Virtual Cards Replenished From Crypto Wallets
Uzbekistanâ€™s National Agency of Perspective Projects (NAPP), a regulatory body working under the countryâ€™s presidential administration, has permitted two domestic banks to issue bank cards for cryptocurrency payments.
In an announcement this week, NAPP said it had approved the participation of Ravnaq Bank in a pilot project to create a virtual bank card that can be topped up with cryptocurrencies. Earlier this month, the agencyâ€¦

Canaan Forced to Trim Mining Power by 2 EH/s
In Kazakhstan, regulatory changes forced Canaanâ€™s hand, making them curtail 2 exahash per second (EH/s) of their mining prowess since July. Thatâ€™s a significant chunk, amounting to half of their mining power across Central Asia and North America. To paint a clearer picture, Canaanâ€™s overall hashrate stood at 4 EH/s as Q1 2023 wrapped up.
While grâ€¦

According to South African officials, over 40 countries are interested in joining the BRICS group, including 23 nations that have formally applied.

Javier Mileiâ€™s Unconventional Policy Proposals
Argentinian presidential hopeful Javier Mileiâ€™s plan to dollarize the economy of the South American country is â€œa far too risky gamble,â€ Mark Sobel, the U.S. chairperson of the Official Monetary and Financial Institutions Forum (OMFIF), has said. entry.title: BRICS Expansion Will Speed Up De-Dollarization, Chinese Expert Says
entry.summary:
As more countries join the BRICS economic bloc, there will be a significant increase in settlements using national currencies, leading to an acceleration in the de-dollarization process, a Chinese expert says. â€œFor most developing countries, development is a top priority. That is why the BRICS cooperation mechanism is attractive to these countries,â€ he added.
BRICS and De-Dollarization
Sun Qi, executive director of the Center for Russian and Central Asian Studies at the Shanghai Academy of Social Sciences, told Russian news outlet Tass Friday that more countries joining the BRICS economic bloc will increase the use of national currencies in settlements significantly, which will help accelerate de-dollarization. The BRICS nations comprise Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africâ€¦

entry.title: FTXâ€™s Sam Bankman-Fried Wants To Be In Jail Only On Weekends
entry.summary:
On August 11, a Judge ruled that disgraced FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) be remanded in the Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) after he was found guilty of violating his bail conditions. However, just a week after, SBF is asking to be released under special circumstances.Â
SBF Asking For Weekday Bail
In a letter dated August 18, sent to US District Judge Lewis Kaplan, SBFâ€™s lawyers ask that SBF be released on weekdays to enable them to prepare for his defense adequately. This comes after the lawyers rejected the prosecutorsâ€™ initial plan on how SBF would prepare for his trial, which begins on October 2.Â
Federal Prosecutors reportedly gave SBF two days a week without adequate tools to handle the voluminosity of his case files. SBFâ€™s lawyers have tagged this prep timâ€¦

entry.title: Economist Lord Jim Oâ€™Neill Calls BRICS Currency Idea â€˜Ridiculousâ€™ â€” Says China and India Never Agree on Anything
entry.summary:
Lord Jim Oâ€™Neill, the British economist credited with coining the acronym BRIC, calls the creation of a common BRICS currency â€œridiculous,â€ emphasizing that the BRICS nations have â€œnever achieved anything since they first started meeting.â€ He added: â€œItâ€™s a good job for the West that China and India never agree on anything, because if they did the dominance of the dollar would be a lot more vulnerable.â€
Lord Jim Oâ€™Neill Slams Common BRICS Currency Idea
British economist Lord Jim Oâ€™Neill shared his view on the proposed single BRICS currency in an interview with the Financial Times this week. The BRICS leaders are set to meet at the economic blocâ€™s 15th summit on Aug. 22-24 in Johannesburg. South Africa is the host of the BRICS summit this year. However, there are mixed reports on whetheâ€¦

entry.title: OpenSea Will No Longer Support NFTs Minted On This Blockchain
entry.summary:
In November last year, NFT marketplace Opensea announced that the Binance Smart Chain Chain (BSC) was one of the several blockchains it was adding support for. However, that collaboration seems to be ending less than a year after.
OpenSea To End Support For BSC NFTs
In an announcement on the X (formerly Twitter) platform on August 17, the NFT marketplace stated that users would no longer be able to list or buy NFTs minted on the BSC chain. However, users â€œwill still be able to view, discover, and transfer BSC NFTsâ€ on the platform.Â
According to OpenSea, this decision was made as part of its cost-reduction efforts. Apparently, the cost of maintaining BSC NFTs â€œoutweighsâ€ the companyâ€™s profits from this venture.Â
This decision will undoubtedly surprise many, considering that Binanâ€¦

entry.title: US Court Classifies Tornado Cash as â€˜Personâ€™ in Verdict Echoing Ooki DAO Designation
entry.summary:
A recent ruling by a U.S. judge declared that Tornado Cash holds the legal status of a â€œperson.â€ This development came on the heels of a previous verdict in June, which recognized the decentralized autonomous organization Ooki DAO in a similar manner.
U.S. Judiciary Designates Tornado Cash as â€˜Personâ€™ in OFAC Case
In a legal face-off with the U.S. government, specifically the OFAC, the plaintiffs posited that Tornado Cash is simply decentralized software. On the contrary, the government viewed it as an organization facilitating cryptocurrency mixing. Central to the dispute was whether the OFAC held the power to impose sanctions on Tornado Cash, and if such an action infringes on the plaintiffsâ€™ freedom of speech.
Yet, the court dismissed the plaintiffsâ€™ stance, recognizing Tornado Caâ€¦

entry.title: Interlocutory Filing Sheds Light On SECâ€™s Stance Regarding XRPâ€™s Security Status
entry.summary:
Amid the SEC vs Ripple case, the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has filed an interlocutory appeal on XRPâ€™s security status and has made an inquiry from the US District Court in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) to certify its appeal against Ripple Labs.
This significant step in the SEC vs Ripple case originated due to a federal judgeâ€™s ruling that said on XRP sales conducted through exchanges did not breach securities law.
The judge in charge of the SEC vs Ripple case, Judge Torres Analisa then said the agency could proceed to file a motion for leave for an interlocutory appeal, this prompted the SEC to request for an interlocutory appeal.
SECâ€™s Interlocutory Appeal On Ripple Case

entry.title: Opensea Phases Out BNB Smart Chain Support, Citing Resource Alignment With Promising Efforts
entry.summary:
One of the largest non-fungible token (NFT) platforms, Opensea, has declared its decision to withdraw BNB Smart Chain (BSC) support. Opensea revealed that the â€œcost to continue supporting BSC outweighs the impact.â€
Opensea Pivots Away From BNB Smart Chain in Strategy Re-evaluation
On August 18, 2023, Opensea proclaimed that they would cease BSC support after incorporating multiple blockchains over recent years. This announcement coincides with Openseaâ€™s strategy to phase out the enforcement of NFT royalties. Concerning BSC support, Opensea stated that as the industry advances, the company needs to â€œalign resources with the most promising efforts.â€
â€œWeâ€™ve decided the cost to continue supporting BSC outweighs the impact,â€ Opensea said. â€œStarting today, you will no longer be able to create new listings for or make new offers on BSC NFTs. However, you will still be able to view, discover, and transfer BSC NFTs on our site.â€
In response to Openseaâ€™s X thread publication, some individuals claimed they were unaware of BSC supportâ€™s existence. Others seized this chance to voice their grievances about the royalty ruling. One individual commented, â€œIDK what kind of system you guys are running over there but itâ€™s not that expensive to run BSC if you do it right.â€
Opensea concluded by asserting their continued optimism regarding a multi-chain future and shared that they recently added support for layer two (L2) blockchains Base and Zora. â€œWeâ€™re confident this decision will help us direct resources to keep pace with the rapid innovation in our ecosystem,â€ added Opensea.
What do you think about Opensea dropping BSC support? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

entry.title: Crypto Lender Helio Faces Regulatory Penalties In Australia For False License Claims
entry.summary:
Melbourne-based cryptocurrency lending firm Helio has been subjected to penalties by the Australian Securities and Investment Commission (ASIC) for making false claims about holding an Australian credit license (ACL).
Enforced since 2009 through the National Consumer Credit Protection Bill, the ACL mandates strict criteria for entities offering financial services to consumers, extending to crypto lenders like Helio.
Helio, a subsidiary of US-based Cyios Corporation, which also owns the NFT platform Randomly, falsely publicized its possession of an ACL 391330 credit license in an August 2019 news article.
Helio: False Claims And ASICâ€™s Action
However, subsequent investigations by Australian regulators uncovered the anomalies of claims made by Helio. The lenderâ€™s assertion of obtaiâ€¦

entry.title: OpenAI Just Bought a Game Studioâ€”But Why?
entry.summary: The ChatGPT creator acquired Global Illumination for an undisclosed amount.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor on AI's Impact on Video Games
entry.summary: Ben Prendergast is an actor who has voiced characters like Apex Legends' Fuse, God of War Ragnarok's Tyr, and Patroclus in Hades. But as debates swirl around the use of artificial intelligence in entertainment in light of the SAG-AFTRA and WGA strikes, Prendergast gives Decrypt's Kate Irwin his honest take on the potential use of AI actors in games.

entry.title: Star Atlas CEO on Developing an MMO Game
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson speaks with Star Atlas Founder and CEO Michael Wagner about the MMO game's approach to development, marketing, and blockchain integrations.

entry.title: Aurory's Origin Story: How JRPGs Inspired the Games
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson talks to Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development Michael Natoli about the origins of the Aurory crypto games at the Solana PlayGG event.

entry.title: Parallel TCG: Inside the Sci-Fi Card Gameâ€™s Closed Beta
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes hands-on with Parallelâ€™s closed beta on Windows PC to find out what sets it apart from other crypto card-battlers.

entry.title: Web3 Games Need to Compete with All Games, Says Solana Foundation GM
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Solana's PlayGG conference and shares his take on crypto gaming and the "play-to-earn" concept.

entry.title: Many Early Blockchain Games Were 'Cash Grabs,' Says Twitch Streamer Alliestrasza
entry.summary: "I wrote them off," Twitch streamer Alliestrasza said of her initial thoughts on many early blockchain games. She tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how her perspective on Web3 games has evolved over time and now sees blockchain games getting significantly better.

entry.title: 'MetalCore' Game Preview: Hands-on With the 'Titanfall' Meets 'Destiny' NFT Mashup
entry.summary: MetalCore is an upcoming mech shooter developed by Studio 369, and it's being developed on Ethereum scaling network Immutable zkEVM. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin played through the prologue and tested out the recent Alpha 3 online experience to get a sense of the NFT-infused mashup of Titanfall and Destiny.

entry.title: 'Give Projects a Chance,' Says Aurory's Michael Natoli on NFT Game Challenges
entry.summary: Aurory is an NFT-driven game franchise that started life on Solana and is expanding to other chains. Decrypt's Jason Nelson spoke with Aurory Head of Marketing Michael Natoli at Solana's PlayGG event, where Natoli shared his thoughts on the challenges that blockchain games face in reaching players.

entry.title: Solana Is Only Network Ready for Gaming: Solana Foundation's Johnny Lee
entry.summary: Solana Foundation General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Solana network will tackle the scaling problem that blockchain games pose for the industry.

entry.title: Com2uS Is Going "Full Speed" on Crypto Gaming: Kyu Lee
entry.summary: Kyu Lee is the President of game studio Com2uS USA. In an interview, he shares the studio's approach to Web3 and crypto gaming with Decrypt GG's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Building a Discord Game with AI and Blockchain: 'Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos' Creative Lead Alex Finden
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson interviews Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos Creative Director Alex Finden at the Solana PlayGG event in San Diego, California.

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin TvrdiÄ‡, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.
